title: Assets to be seized if IGP Tennakoon evades court: Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Public Security Sunil Watagala said that if Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon continues to evade court proceedings, his movable and immovable assets will be freezed in accordance with legal provisions.

title: Deal between Anura, Tiran prevents Deshabandu’s arrest: Champika
byline: Former Minister Patali Champika Ranawaka alleged that a deal between President Anura Kumara Dissanayake and former Minister Tiran Alles has prevented the arrest of former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: 57 Independent group, 18 parties pay deposits for Local Elections
byline: A total of 57 independent groups and 18 political parties have paid their deposits for the upcoming local government elections, according to the Election Commission.

title: Police Commission approves transfer of 9 SSPs and 28 OICs
byline: Nine Senior Superintendents of Police (SSP), including the director of the Bribery Commission and 28 Police OICs, have been transferred with immediate effect.

title: Liquor production increased by 22% within last two months: CoPF reveals
byline: A Parliamentary Committee revealed that the production of liquor in the country has increased by 22% within the last two months while revenue has grown by 23%.

title: J&K Assembly in uproar over alleged free land allotment to Murali
byline: The Jammu and Kashmir government found itself in a contentious situation on Saturday following allegations of a 25-acre free land allotment to Sri Lankan cricketer Muttiah Muralitharan’s company, Ceylon Beverages.

title: Shooting in Gampaha injures two
byline: Two persons were injured and hospitalised after two persons on a motorcycle opened fire at him at Akkarawita in Gampaha..

title: IndiGo starts daily direct flights between Tamil Nadu, Sri Lanka
byline: IndiGo, India’s largest and most preferred low cost airline announced the launch of daily direct flights between Tiruchirappalli (Trichy) in Tamil Nadu and Sri Lanka from March 30.

title: Twelve injured in shooting at Toronto pub
byline: A dozen people have been injured in a shooting at a Toronto pub and three suspects are still at large, police in the Canadian city say.

title: New laws to ban corporal punishment soon: Minister
byline: A new law to ban corporal punishment will be introduced soon, Minister of Justice Harshana Nanayakkara told Parliament today.

title: Adani’s response expected within two weeks: Minister
byline: The wind power project that was to be carried out with the Adani Company has not been cancelled yet, Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody said.

title: IMF Chief congratulates Sri Lanka on economic progress
byline: Kristalina Georgieva, the Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), congratulated Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake on the country’s notable economic progress.

title: Former Army Chief of Staff Nanda Mallawaarachchi granted bail
byline: Former Chief of Staff of the Sri Lanka Army, (Rtd) Major General Nanda Mallawaarachchi, has been released on bail by the Colombo Fort Magistrate following an application to effect that there was a possibility of his arrest by the CID in connection with the procurement of sports equipment for the Ministry of Sports in 2014.

title: Viruliya Sevana to organise International Women’s Day programme tomorrow
byline: Viruliya Sevana, an association of officers and other ranks who are retired from the armed forces of Sri Lanka, has organized a blessing ceremony tomorrow (8) in line with the International Women’s Day 2025.
